cobblemon.species.sableye-dawnian.name: Sableye
cobblemon.species.sableye-dawnian.desc: These sableye have adapted to the cold, living in icy caves deep underground, and have formed a pack-like dynamic with others of its kind. This allows them to hunt their favorite prey, Carbink, much more efficiently.
cobblemon.species.luxray-dawnian.desc: Roaming the tundra alone after exile from its pride, this Luxray endured a brutal defeat and the unforgiving cold. Trainers say earning its trust is as rare as seeing lightning during a blizzard.
cobblemon.species.lilligant-dawnian.name: Lilligant
cobblemon.species.lilligant-dawnian.desc: This form of lilligant maintains the ecosystem using controlled wildfires and is naturally into gardening. Only found in during dawn
cobblemon.species.meloetta-pirouette.des: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
cobblemon.species.spidopsunbound.name: Spidops-UB
cobblemon.species.spidopsunbound.desc: Spidop's in its purest for of humility. U-N-B-O-U-N-D
cobblemon.species.scameleon.name: Scameleon
cobblemon.species.scameleon.desc: Scameleon can become completely invisible and nearly intangible,  often stealing from smaller Pokemon. However, this Pokemon avoids Sobble, due to the fear of its natural rival Inteleon- the only pokemon able to detect it- lurking nearby.
cobblemon.species.numel-dawnian.name: Numel
cobblemon.species.numel-dawnian.desc: Spending time in a colder environment caused them to harden. To warm up, this Pokémon soaked in nearby hot springs. Over time, spring water seeped inside and replaced the hot magma in their bodies.
cobblemon.species.camerupt-dawnian.name: Camerupt
cobblemon.species.camerupt-dawnian.desc: Their bodies contain mineral rich water with panacea-like properties, making them a popular target for people and Pokémon alike. As a result, they tend to avoid fights, choosing to camouflage along the spring bed instead. Camerupt often form symbiotic relationships with Numel, allowing them to plug up the stumps on their back in exchange for providing warmth.
cobblemon.species.lameyser.name: Lameyser
cobblemon.species.lameyser.desc: When a Dawnian Camerupt absorbs enough spring water over a long period of time without release, the vast amounts of water and heat in their body causes the geyser on their back to erupt violently, evolving them into Lameyser. They are often seen assisting injured Pokémon and allowing them to soak in the hot springs they produce.
cobblemon.species.yamask-dawnian.name: Yamask
cobblemon.species.yamask-dawnian.desc: This pokemon is said to be what remains of a spirit seeking riches, eternally searching for wealth as punishment. They are often found near ruins or areas containing great treasures, hunting the Gimmighoul that gather around the area.
cobblemon.species.luderigus.name: Luderigus
cobblemon.species.luderigus.desc: Finally gathering enough coins to pay off its debt, Luderigus preys on the less fortunate. It allows them to spin the lever on its side, siphoning away their life force for a chance at a jackpot. This pokemon often engages in brutal clashes with Gholdengo, incorporating their bodies into itself.
cobblemon.species.heracross-dawnian.name: Heracross
cobblemon.species.heracross-dawnian.desc: This pokemon has adapted to cave living, incorporating scavenged minerals into its exoskeleton. It has adapted large claws in order to dig tunnels, as well as to fend off Aron and Lairon that attempt to eat the rare earth metals on its back.
cobblemon.species.tachyaton.name: Tachyaton
cobblemon.species.dripplin.name: Dripplin
